docs.lead_paragraph: IN recent years, physicians have had to diagnose an increasing number of ailments the likes of which they never saw and perhaps never even read about during their medical training. These are the toxic side effects of megadose vitamin therapy, usually self-prescribed regimens taken by unsuspecting individuals hoping to enhance their health. Instead, they sometimes wind up sick, or sicker than they were in the first place. Only about 7 percent of the estimated 40 million Americans who regularly take vitamins do so under the guidance of a physician. Toxic effects of megadoses have been uncovered for the majority of vitamins, including some, like vitamins A and C, that are very popular among nonprescription users. Even some of the water-soluble B vitamins, commonly thought to be nontoxic in any amount because they are rapidly cleared from the body, are now known to cause devastating effects in megadose quantities.

headline.main: VITAMIN THERAPY: TOXIC SIDE EFFECTS OF MASSIVE DOESE
